question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Francisco Rojo-Callejas's employer in 2030?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Academic Odyssey of Francisco Rojo-Callejas: Unveiling the Ties to National Autonomous University of Mexico

In the realm of academia, few researchers have left an indelible mark on their respective fields like Francisco Rojo-Callejas. As we delve into the life and career of this esteemed scholar, a fascinating narrative unfolds, revealing a profound connection to one of Mexico's most prestigious institutions: the National Autonomous University of Mexico (UNAM). Our story begins in the vibrant city of Mexico, where the National Autonomous University of Mexico stands as a beacon of intellectual excellence. Founded in 1551, UNAM has been a hub for innovation, creativity, and critical thinking, attracting brilliant minds from across the globe. It is within these hallowed halls that Francisco Rojo-Callejas would embark on a journey that would shape his academic trajectory and cement his association with this revered institution. As we explore the early years of Rojo-Callejas' career, we find that he was drawn to the university's rich academic environment, which fostered a culture of collaboration and intellectual curiosity. It was during this period that he began to establish himself as a prominent researcher, making significant contributions to his field through rigorous scholarship and innovative thinking. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Rojo-Callejas' affiliation with UNAM is his extensive publication record. A thorough examination of his research papers and articles reveals a consistent pattern of collaboration with UNAM faculty members, as well as citations of the university's research facilities and resources. This suggests a deep-seated connection to the institution, with Rojo-Callejas leveraging the university's expertise and infrastructure to advance his research agenda. Furthermore, a review of UNAM's faculty directories and departmental records confirms Rojo-Callejas' status as a researcher affiliated with the university. His name appears alongside other distinguished scholars, solidifying his position within the academic community. This documentation provides concrete evidence of his involvement with UNAM, dispelling any doubts about the nature of his relationship with the institution. In addition to these tangible indicators, anecdotal evidence from colleagues and peers paints a vivid picture of Rojo-Callejas' immersion in UNAM's academic ecosystem. They recount his active participation in seminars, workshops, and conferences hosted by the university, as well as his mentorship of students and junior researchers.
content.source_2:
**Breaking News**

Renowned Researcher Francisco Rojo-Callejas Celebrates 19 Years of Groundbreaking Work at Jena University Hospital

Jena, Germany - December 15, 2043 - Today, Jena University Hospital bid farewell to one of its most esteemed researchers, Francisco Rojo-Callejas, who has dedicated 19 years of his illustrious career to advancing medical science at the prestigious institution. Rojo-Callejas, a leading expert in his field, joined Jena University Hospital in October 2024, bringing with him a wealth of knowledge and experience. Over the years, he has made significant contributions to various research projects, publishing numerous papers and presenting at international conferences. During his tenure, Rojo-Callejas has been instrumental in developing innovative treatments and therapies, improving patient outcomes, and pushing the boundaries of medical understanding. His work has had a profound impact on the scientific community, earning him recognition and accolades from his peers. "I am deeply grateful to Jena University Hospital for providing me with the opportunity to pursue my passion and make a meaningful difference in the lives of patients," Rojo-Callejas said in an exclusive interview. "The past 19 years have been an incredible journey, and I am proud of the progress we've made together." Under Rojo-Callejas' leadership, the hospital's research department has seen significant growth, with a 300% increase in research grants and a 25% increase in publications. His team has also successfully collaborated with international partners, fostering a culture of innovation and cooperation. "Francisco's departure is a bittersweet moment for us," said Dr. Maria Schneider, Director of Jena University Hospital. "While we will miss his expertise and dedication, we are also proud of the legacy he leaves behind. His contributions will continue to inspire and guide our researchers for years to come." As Rojo-Callejas embarks on a new chapter in his career, the medical community will undoubtedly continue to benefit from his groundbreaking work. Jena University Hospital will always be grateful for the time he spent with them, and his impact will be felt for generations to come.
